ComicInfo.Summary:
False advertisement for pubic hair stencils from actor Mickey Rourke.
Bambiffpow Jackson applies for a job.
Snake and Bacon travel back in time to investigate bacon smuggling and meet Cassanova.
Picasso objects to having his life story narrated by a hamburger.
A faux ad for the hair-care product Monk-B-Gone.
A faux ad for the Fabulous Nut Bra.
A brief discussion of Depression Era bordellos located in holes in the ground and on blimps.
Robin Hood and King Arthur write a drinking song.
Kip takes a nap.
A professor explains the origins of Easter as rites honoring Jesus's half-brother, Pagus.
A faux ad for sex blimps.
Uncle Billy narrates brief sketches of raccoons, zebras, warthogs, and polecats.
Two tiny hobos move into Mr. Flopears' ear.
The story of the hottest new boy band.
Tips for kids studying Shakespeare and looking for his lost treasure.
A couple of boys run into Big Top on the street.
Sherlock Holmes uses his magnifying glass to burn the vine that Jungle Boy is swinging on.
Prof. Pumpkin sends Pig Boy, his friend, and their dog into space.
Henry gets a modern sculpture.
Drunk Pirate District Attorney is ejected from court.
Einstein devises a race between dogs and salmon.
A recollection of the city overtaking the country.
A recollection of 1930s entertainment.
King Grampa gets ironic revenge on a bird.
Grampa won't eat a restaurant meal.
Grampa enjoys some nonsensical silhouettes.
Grampa drives an amoeba car.
Buzz Aldrin discovers the body of Ted, the radio operator.
Johnny Jett and the Fat Russian pursue a murderer.
Two cowboys have a fistfight over the literary value of comics.
The Mannister can find no cases in which to use his talents.
